thread.title: FACULTY HONOR: Three Princeton faculty elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences
thread.title_full: FACULTY HONOR: Three Princeton faculty elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences

author: Staff
title: FACULTY HONOR: Three Princeton faculty elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences
text:
FACULTY HONOR: Three Princeton faculty elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences by Staff e-mail | print 
235th Class of Members : Sanjeev Arora , the Charles C. Fitzmorris Professor in Computer Science ; Martin Gilens , a professor of politics ; and Ali Yazdani , the Class of 1909 Professor of Physics . The three are among 147 people elected to the class. Founded in 1780, the academy is one of the country's oldest learned societies and independent policy research centers, and currently includes 4,600 members.
